utterances: Nothing, and of course if you look at the history of sixth year in a presidential term, this would be the sixth year in 2014, will be the sixth year of the Obama presidency, and the out party often, almost always, does much better, does really well.
Of course in 2008 - in 1998 with Clinton and Monica Lewinsky, the Republican Party was thought to overreach, and the Democrats actually won.
But for the most part, a sixth year in a presidency is bad news for the president's party.

And that's good news for Terry McAuliffe, the former DNC chair who is the only announced Democrat in that race for the governorship.
And the attorney general, a conservative figure there, Mr. Cuccinelli, seen as the favorite for the Republican nomination, but he will not go unopposed.
Right, Bill Bolling, Bill Bolling is the lieutenant governor.
